line.en: 'It went that way!'
'Leave it to me!'
At Ageha's signal, I ran ahead to block the cat's\nescape route.
'Meow...'
Ageha and I blocked the stray cat's paths, and it\nsearched for a third route.
And there, was...
'Come here, kitty!'
There was Kotori, as she made an almost\nsickeningly cheerful smile.
'Look, I've got those anchovies that you like.\nThere are soooooo many of them!'
Now that's how to talk to a cat.
Kotori dangles an anchovy, which captivates the\ncat.
'Meow...'
However, as expected of a stray cat: it won't let\ndown its guard so easily
'(Kotori! Use the secret weapon!)'
Kotori nods and takes out a small fishing rod.
An anchovy hangs on the end of the line.
'Meow?'
'Look, look!'
Dangle dangle.
'M, meooow...'
Just like a blessing descending from heaven, the\nanchovy draws the stray cat's attention.
With Kotori's skillful waving of the rod, she was\nalmost literally reeling the cat towards her with\nthe anchovy.
'Come on, come on.'
'Meow, meow!'
Just as the cat reaches out its paw, Kotori times\nthe pulling away of the anchovy so that the cat\ncannot reach it.
It really was a little bit mean.
Eventually, the cat, running out of patience,\nused its last resort.
'Meow!'
Jump!
The cat jumped up onto Kotori's lap all by\nitself!
'I've got you!'
'Meow!'
Amazingly, the cat settled into Kotori's arms.
'Alright! The plan was a big success!'
'...I can't believe it fell for such a stupid\nplan.'
I felt like saying 'C'mon, stray cat, you can do\nbetter than that!
'Hee hee, good kitty!'
Kotori shows a side that we'd never seen before,\nand smiles affectionately while stroking the cat.
The cat seems like it doesn't really enjoy being\nstroked. But, he's too focused on the large\namount of anchovies to run away.
'You're cute, aren't you? You're a good boy,\naren't you?'
'Munch, munch... Meooooow!'
'This cat is quite beautiful considering he's a\nstray. Hello there!'
Ageha starts stroking him too.
All girls like cats.
'...Is it OK if I stroke him too?'
'Meow!'
'See, this cat's not scared!'
'We went through so much trouble to catch him, we\ncan't just let him go now!''
'Hmm... But I like cats too...'
This seems a bit unfair.
'What's next?'
'Next...is...'
I open the notebook to check.
'Things I want to do'
It's the list of bullet points that Kotori has\nwritten in her notebook.
'First of all, 'Stroke a cat' has been\ncompleted.'
We are now in the middle of clearing Kotori's\nlist of things she still has left to do.
As Ageha and I look at the notebook, Kotori looks\nat us sideways, but not with suspicion.
How did this situation occur?
To answer that, we need to go back to this\nmorning.
This morning, I was ambivalent as to whether or\nnot I should return the withdrawal notice that I\npicked up to its rightful owner.
Of course, you should typically return lost items\nback to the owner. But, if I had done that, then\nKotori would leave the dorm. So, I kept it.
If that's what she wants to do, then I have no\nright to stop her. But, I was still hesistant for\nsome reason.
So, I was pacing back and forth along the\nhallway, until...
Kotori, who was wearing her uniform, poked her\nhead out from her room.
She was furtively checking the situation outside.
As our eyes meet, she slams the door shut.
'...Why is she acting so suspiciously?'
Kotori is always doing something suspicious, but\nthere is definitely something behind her behavior\njust now.
I concealed myself in the dining hall for a\nwhile.
I wait 10 minutes.
Hat appears from the little door at the bottom of\nKotori's bedroom door.
Hat took a look around the entranceway, then came\ninto the dining hall.
'Quack?'
'Shh!'
Hat goes back to Kotori's room.
'There was no one there?'
'Quack, quack!'
'Alright.'
What does she mean by 'alright'?
Kotori came sneaking out of her room.
She took a peek into the dining hall just to be\nsafe. I hid behind the counter.
'Looks like no one's here... If that guy catches\nme, he'll make such a fuss.'
When she says 'that guy', it feels like she's\ntalking about me.
Kotori is wearing her uniform but she isn't\ncarrying her bag.
In the entranceway, she opens up her notebook and\nlooks inside.
I sneaked up behind her.
'I did this before, so today...'
'Are you going to skip school again today?'
'EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEK!!!'
Kotori jumped, let out a scream and threw the\nnotebook.
'W...wha wha wha what are you doing here!? But I\njust checked!'
'That's why you should stop sending a duck to\nscout for you.'
As I pick up the notebook that she dropped, I\nlook at the open page.
'Things I want to do'
This is the page I saw before.
'Give my notebook back!'
'Could it be that you are planning to do all of\nthis before you quit school?'
Seems like I was spot on.
'...I'm going to finish all the things remaining\ntoday. That's enough, now give it back.'
I handed back the notebook.
Then I follow Kotori as she is about to leave.
'...Why are you following me?'
'I'm going to help.'
'Huh? Why?'
'It must be tough by yourself, right?'
Kotori looks at me like I'm an idiot.
While we stop in front of the door, the doorbell\nrings.
'Who could it be at this time?'
'Good morning!'
'Ageha.'
'Oh? You're both here?'
'What did you come here for??'
'Well, I...'
Ageha pulls me towards her and whispers into my\near.
'(Yesterday, something felt a bit strange, and I\nthought she might start skipping school again.)'
So she came all the way here to ask Kotori to go\nto school with her?
'Bull's eye.'
'Seriously?'
'Yeah. The truth is that...'
How should I explain this?
'Kotori, I'm just gonna borrow your notebook.'
I go back to Kotori and take the notebook.
'Ah, hey!'
Using that, I explain the situation to Ageha.
I explain that today, she wants to finish the\n'Things I want to do' list that is written in\nthis notebook.
I don't tell her about Kotori's plan to quit\nschool.
'This looks like a big job...'
Ageha groans a little as she looks at the list.
'That's right. This is why I'm taking a day off\nschool.'
'...I guess that's the only way.'
'I'll help too.'
That is how Ageha and I ended up going with\nKotori (against her wishes) to clear the things\nremaining on the list one by one.
By the way, as far as us urgently searching for\nmembers for the club goes, last night, we came up\nwith a possible prospect.
That's why we're going with Kotori.
'That's enough, now go to school, you two!'
said Kotori while stroking the cat, but we don't\nlisten.
'OK, next is Pedigree at Ito's house.'
Ageha pointed and read

*Stroke the head of the big dog in the
neighborhood. (it's really scary but it might be
unexpectedly friendly. If possible, I'd like to
ride around on its back.)
from the list.
The Ito family are rich and have a well-known and\nvery large dog called Pedigree that roams around\nfreely in their garden.
When we were kids, it was rare to see such big\ndogs and we would often watch him lumbering\naround their spacious lawn.
'I'd like to ride around on its back...?'
So far, I have lifted up Kotori on two occasions.
Both times, she was as light as a feather...\nWell, perhaps that's slightly exaggerating. But,\nshe really was light.
'If it's Kotori, she should just about be able to\ndo it. He is a Saint Bernard, after all.'
Pedigree is a Saint Bernard. They're pretty huge.
While seriously considering Kotori's silly idea,\nwe headed towards the Ito's house.
'Phew... I've started to sweat!'
said Ageha as she put the baggage down on the\ngrass.
'But there's a breeze here, which feels good.'
Today is dry and sunny, and the temperature isn't\nthat high.
It's quite hot in the sunlight but there's a nice\nbreeze.
'Here!'
I throw a sports drink to Ageha.
'Oh, thanks!'
'There's one for you too, Kotori.'
I take some orange juice from the convenience\nstore bag and pass it to Kotori.
'...Thanks.'
'Do you want to sit down here?'
'Huh? Umm...'
'Ageha, gimme a hand would you?'
Ageha, who looks like she's enjoying her sports\ndrink, gets up and comes over.
'What are you doing?'
'I want to put you down here.'
'Th-There's no need!'
'Oh, I see.'
I leave lifting up Kotori to Ageha, and tell her\nhow to do it, while I give a hand from the side.
'OK, here we go...whew!'
'Thanks...'
Kotori sits down on the grass, and looks\ncomfortable as she stretches her back.
'Ahh... my butt was getting a bit hot...'
It seems that wheelchairs can get quite hot in\nthe summer.
'OK, time for the lunchboxes!'
The time is now 12:30.
It's exactly the time for lunch break.
We spread out the lunchboxes that we brought, and\nthe juice and snacks we bought from the\nconvenience store.
We don't have a sheet but it feels like we're\nhaving a picnic.
'Itadakimaasu!'
'...Itadakimasu.'
I made both mine and Kotori's lunchboxes, while\nAgeha had brought her own.
'Munch, munch...'
'Oh, you've got a burger, Kotori. Hey, wanna\ntrade it for my spring roll?'
'...Sure.'
'Alright!'
Ageha wolfs down the burger that she got by\ntrading. She looks like she's enjoying it.
'Aoi, you're good at cooking, aren't you? It\nmakes me lose my confidence as a woman.'
'Your mom's good at cooking though, isn't she?'
'No, no, I can't be compared to a career\nhousewife.'
Kotori's face seemed to say that she wasn't\nreally suited to this situation, as she quietly\nate her lunch.
However, she didn't look as irritated as she was\nbefore.
Ageha either hadn't noticed, or was pretending\nnot to have noticed, and carried on behaving the\nsame way she always does.
'This is the first time I've skipped school!'
'The only time I've thought that I wanted to take\na day off was on the day of the injection.'
'But if you can hang out with your friends like\nthis, maybe it's OK sometimes!'
said Ageha playfully.
She seems quite excited about skipping school for\nthe first time.
'If your mom finds out, she's totally gonna kick\nyour ass.'
Ageha's mother doesn't hold back when she gives\nher daughters a kick in the ass.
I've been kicked too, many times. Like when Ageha\nand I got caught playing tricks.
Those kicks are big, heavy and painful.
'That's why you can't tell her.'
'Ok, got it. She'd kick me too for something like\nthis.'
I say that, but I don't want her to worry\nunnecessarily.
'Hey, what's next?'
We all look at the notebook.
We managed to finish five of them this morning.
As for Pedigree, the Itos recognized Ageha, and\nthey let us into the garden.
We weren't able to have her ride on his back.\nBut, Kotori gave Pedigree a hug. So, we counted\nthat as a success.
In the end, it was quite tough for her to roll\naround and play with him.
Pedigree probably weighs more than Kotori.
On top of that, he licked her all over her face.\nShe looked like she was ecstatic.
'Go to Cafe Flags.'
Ageha reads out from the list.
'Where is that?'
'It's over there, in Windy...'
'I... don't need to go there!'
Kotori, who had suddenly gone red, drew a line\nthrough that entry with a red pen.
Ageha whispers into her ear.
'(Is there someone you want to go there with?)'
'(No! It's just your misunderstanding!)'
Something was said to Kotori and now she's\ndesperately trying to cover something up. What\ncould it be?
'It's quite a grown-up cafe. It's run by a famous\npatissier, and serves delicious sweets.'
'Hmm, do you want to go there?'
'I...said 'no', it was just a misunderstanding!'
'I just heard someone talking about it at school,\nso I thought it sounded good, that's all...'
'I didn't know... about that kind of place...'
'That kind of place??'
It's not just a normal cafe?
'It's aimed at couples, so there are tons of\ncustomers like that.'
'The young women in Kazegaura go there on dates,\nso going there is a kind of status symbol!'
'I really didn't know about it!'
POW!
Kotori points at me.
She's strongly denying it, but it's not like I\nreally have any suspicions about it.
'Why don't you go with Aoi?'
'Wh, wha, wha, wha, what are you talking about??\nI didn't write anything about that!... Unh...'
Kotori had gone red and was looking down.
'Well... I don't mind. Is that place expensive?'
'The cakes are about 800 yen per piece. The tea\nis about the same price.'
That is a little steep...
'The homemade mille feuille is one of the most\npopular things on the menu and is really\ndelicious, apparently.'
'That's 1300 yen.'
'For one cake!?'
I guess it is in the same place as the\nsupermarket that sells high grade marbled meat\nfor 2980 yen for 100 grams.
For doing the work of the dorm mother, I can get\na small allowance from my mom, so...
'Next month will be OK.'
'I just told you, I don't need to go...!!'
'I just heard from someone that it's a trendy\nshop that sells delicious cakes and tea!'
'As for goting there on a d-d-date with a boy?! I\nnever said I wanted to do that!'
'I never said it!'
It must be important, because she said it twice.
I was overwhelmed by her vigor, and nodded\nwithout saying anything.
'Alright, that's the end of that conversation.'
As she one-sidedly dropped that subject, she used\nthe pen to thoroughly blot out that entry.
'Hmph, there we go...'
It might have bled through to the other side of\nthe page.
'...Aoi, you look a little disappointed, don't\nyou?'
'Huh? No I don't!'
'You have a sweet tooth, don't you?'
'Y...yeah.'
I wouldn't get disappointed about something like\nthat.
Besides, did I really look disappointed?
Ageha cleared away the lunchboxes and opened a\nbag of snacks.
We bought a lot because it felt like we were\ngoing on an excursion.
While Ageha eats some Prech snacks, she takes\nanother look at the notebook after Kotori had\nfinished blotting it out.
Speaking of which, we were in the middle of\ntalking about what to do next.
'...Hey, what's that?'
Ageha was looking at the entry at the number 1\nspot on the list.
It was written much bigger than the other\nentries.
I want to pass through the passage of cloud.
'Yeah, I thought that was quite mysterious too.\nWhat is that?'
'I don't know.'
'Whadya mean 'you don't know'...?'
'I'm not the one who wrote this.'
answered Kotori while crunching the Prech snacks\nthat Ageha had given her.
Now that she mentions it, the handwriting is\ndifferent.
*Eat as much Hargen Darch as I want.
and so on are written in nice, uniform writing.
Compared to the meticulously neat handwriting, 'I\nwant to pass through the passage of cloud' was\nwritten in a way that seemed bold and spirited.
'So, who wrote it?'
'The owner of the notebook. It was already\nwritten in here when I found it.'
There are a few entries written in this unbridled\nfashion, and below, are the neatly written\nentries.
Kotori had added to it, continuing from what\nsomeone else had written.
'You found it? What do you mean?'
'I found it in my room, when I came to Flying\nFish Manor.'
'It was hidden in a gap between the shelves.'
'So, this isn't your notebook, then?'
'That's right. Maybe it's the diary of someone\nwho lived there before.'
When she says that it's a diary, I feel hesitant\nto just go ahead and open it.
Had Kotori read it?
'...Does that mean, you continued to write in\nsomeone's diary?'
Without thinking, Ageha and I both made a face\nlike 'Why?', while Kotori remained quiet.
I don't think that it's because it would be a\nshame to waste the unused pages.
The thing that I was more concerned with was...
'(I want to pass through the passage of cloud?)'
What is a 'passage of cloud'?
'(If it's clouds we're talking about...)'
I look up.
There is a blue sky and a few clouds, and then, a\ngiant windmill.
The windmill blades moving round slowly in the\nwind, look a lot like the wings of a glider.
'Ok then, next is 'donate blood'!'
'Let's all go and have our blood taken!'
'Phew, that last one was a bit of a toughie!'
'My eyes are still flickering...'
The last thing we did was
*Complete Lady & Silvergun.
the final entry on the list.

If you're wondering what that is, it's a
shoot-em-up game, and until just now, we were at
the video game arcade, where we finally completed
it by repeatedly using continues and taking
turns.
Because it was so hard, it made getting to the\nending all the more impressive.
'Wow, it's a real masterpiece, isn't it?'
'I'm no good at shoot-em-ups...'
The best at this game was Ageha, then Kotori.
It seemed that Kotori had played it from time to\ntime when she skipped school before.

She must have gotten mad with the incredible
difficulty of the game and said 'One day, I will
complete this game!' and added that entry to the
notebook, it seems.
We had to spend 3000 yen to complete it.
'Does that mean we've cleared everything on the\nlist?'
'...Yeah.'
We'd also finished the entries that Kotori hadn't\nwritten while we were at it.
The only one left was to 'pass through the\npassage of clouds'.
Since we didn't know what that meant, we had\nvirtually cleared the whole list.
'Now that we've finished it, doesn't it feel like\nit all ended a bit too quickly...?'
'I'm glad we finished before dinner.'
'Ah ha ha, you're right. If we want to hang out,\nwe should do it again some other day!'
'What's up?'
'N-Nothing...'
Kotori's expression seems dark.
The same as Ageha, it looks like she feels\nunexpectedly disappointed now that it's all over,\nlike it wasn't enough.
'Alright, I'm hungry, I think I'd better head\nback now.'
'Hopefully your mom won't find out about this.'
'It's... it's OK. Our homeroom teacher isn't that\ndiligent.'
'But Hotaru is quite serious. If she realizes\nthat you hadn't gone to school, she might tell\nyour mom, right?'
'Urk... If that happens, I'm taking you down with\nme.'
'What? How could you? Are you gonna tell on me?'
'It's been five years, you should go and get a\nkick in the butt from my mom.'
she said jokingly, and turned to face Kotori.
'Thanks for today. Thanks to you, Kotori, I had a\nreally good time!'
'Yeah...'
'OK, see you tomorrow!'
she said with a smile and turned to leave.
With a spring in her step, she walked up the\ngentle slope.
'Ah!'
'Hmm?'
Kotori went to say something, so Ageha stopped\nwalking.
Kotori looked down and faltered as she spoke.
This time, she looked like she was about to cry.
Ageha waited for a little while for Kotori to\nopen her mouth.
Patiently.
However, Kotori didn't say any more.
'Hey, Kotori.'
'The truth is, I came round today because I had\nsomething I wanted to talk to about.'
'...Something you wanted to talk to me about?'
'Let's be in the Soaring Club together!'
'I heard it from Aoi. You know a lot about\ngliders, don't you? You always had fun when you\nwent to the garage, didn't you?'
'If we're in the club together, it would\ndefinitely be great fun. Every day would be like\ntoday, I'm sure of it! Don't you think?'
Ageha closed her mouth and waited for a reply.
There was no mistake that Kotori was ambivalent.
She was certainly interested in gliders, so I\nthink she would actually really like to join the\nSoaring Club.
That's why now, she might be able to express\nthose feelings.
'...I said I wouldn't do it, didn't I?'
'...But why?'
'Just because. It's got nothing to do with you.'
Ageha's expression dropped at Kotori's blunt\nrefusal.
'Why do you have to say it like that, I\nwonder...?'
'Because you're sticking your nose in.'
'If you feel this way, don't you think that's why\nyou don't get involved in class?'
This time Kotori seemed irritated by Ageha's\nremark.
'Well excuse me for not getting more involved. I\ndon't go kissing up to be everyone's friend like\na certain somebody, that's all.'
'Kissing up to people...?'
'Hold it, calm down both of you.'
'Why are you arguing all of a sudden?'
I step in, so they can't ignore me.
'After we had such a fun day, let's just cut\nit... Whoa!!'
Ageha pushed me aside like I was in her way.
It's no good, it looks like she's quite pissed\noff about the 'kissing up' comment.
'I don't agree with the way everyone has behaved\nrecently. Of course you would feel angry at them\nfor speaking to you like that.'
'However, I also think that you have some\nnegative points.'
'Like what?'
'See, that's what I mean!'
Ageha pointed her finger at Kotori's face as if\nto say 'There, irrefutable evidence!
'...You're always so... how should I say...\ndefiant.'
'That's why everyone misunderstands you.'
'Like how we were hanging out today, couldn't you\nhave opened up a little!?'
'Thank you for kindness. I never asked for it\nthough.'
'You don't have to say it like that! You're\nreally pissing me off!'
'You really are kind.'
'I know all about it. The reason why you've been\nspeaking to me so much, is because our teacher\nasked you to.'
'Grrr...'
Faltering for a moment from hearing Kotori's\nwords, Ageha stayed tight-lipped.
Her cheeks went red.
'Or is the reason why you're being kind to me\nbecause you feel sorry for me?'
'...I'm sick of being treated like that.'
Kotori told her, and turned her wheelchair\nsideways.
'Goodbye.'
'Ah...hey!'
With that, she left by herself.
'Ageha...'
'...It's fine. What she said, it's all true.'
'But, that's not the reason why you did it\nthough, is it?'
'Aren't you also being misunderstood?'
'...I'm sorry. I'll go now.'
Ageha, this time looking like she didn't want to\ntalk, with trembling shoulders, climbed the\ngentle slope.
I watched her from behind as she left and then\nhurried back to the dormitory.
'Kotori. Hey, Kotori!'
Bang bang bang!
'Quack! Quack!'
Hat came out as if to protest about the noise.
'Hey, is your buddy in there?'
'Quack?'
'Get outta the way will ya?'
I move Hat out of the way, and take a peek into\nKotori's room through the duck door.
'Damn, Hat's in the way, I can't see!'
'Hey, you mustn't do that!'
'Ah, Kanako! Has she come back yet?'
'Hmm? It looks like she's still not back...'
'Did something happen?'
'Yeah, kind of...'
'Umm... Can I ask you to prepare dinner?'
'Huh? Me?'
'Please!'
'Ah... You're joking... I can't do that...'
'...Well, you're the one who asked me. Don't\nblame me for whatever happens.'
'...I've had it with all of them.'
'I've washed my hands of all of them.'
'That's not what it looks like though.'
I call out to her but without surprise, Kotori\nlooks at me for a moment, before quickly looking\nback at the lake.
At night, the lake looks like a vast black mass\nof darkness lying sideways.
On the other side is Windmill Hill, which looks\nbeautiful when illuminated.
Since she hadn't come back to the dormitory, I\nguessed that she might be here, and this is where\nI found her.
'What are you doing here? A self-assessment?'
I say it in a light-hearted way but she doesn't\nanswer.
'Let's go back. It's almost time for dinner.'
Kotori shook her head.
'You can't stay here, can you?'
'No way. I don't want to go back.'
'Why not?'
'I don't want today to end...'
she mumbled quietly as her cheeks quivered for a\nmoment.
'What do you mean...?'
'If I go back to my room, it will all be over.'
'...Today was so much fun, I don't want it to\nend.'
It sounded like she was getting tearful.
'...It's been so long... since I spent time...\nwith friends ... like this.'
'Kotori...'
'Even so, it ended with an argument...'
'...Yes, that's true. You can't round off a fun\nday with an argument.'
For me too, today was an unbelievably fun day.
It was like being a kid again, playing stupid\npranks, from sunup, til sundown.
Right now, the thing that makes me feel a little\npleased is the fact that I know that Kotori feels\nthe same way.
'About Ageha...'
'...I didn't see the things that happened in the\nclass, so I can't really say but...'
'...she's a simple person, so I don't think she\nwould've done what the teacher asked if she\ndidn't want to.'
'...Yeah.'
'However, even if she hadn't been asked, she's\nthe type who would just do it anyway.'
'...That sometimes causes problems though,\nright?'
I said jokingly and Kotori smiled just a little.
'...Yeah, I know.'
'And today, she wasn't asked to, but she skipped\nschool with us, didn't she?'
That was the first time she had skipped school,\nand only stuck with us because that's how things\nturned out.
'She's not a bad person. Maybe she really thinks\nthat she wants to be your friend, that's what I\nthink.'
Even Ageha wouldn't go this far just for the sake\nof being kind.
'Hmm?'
'My... legs, became like this... two years\nago...'
'I was in an accident when I was on vacation...'
'Until then, I was just like you and her, walking\naround, running...'
'I had lots of friends and I was in a sports\nclub. I played volleyball.'
'Really?'
I imagine Kotori jumping up from the floor and\nlaunching an attack on the opponent's court.
No doubt about it, she would have been brilliant,\nspectacular.
'Then, my legs were injured in the accident, and\nnow I wouldn't be able to live without a\nwheelchair.'
'The school I went to didn't have any elevators,\nand there were steps all round the school.'
A step of as little as five centimeters is a huge\nobstacle for a wheelchair.
'Even going to school became a huge problem.'
'The life I had before the accident... Going to\neat hamburgers with everyone after school, going\nto buy clothes...'
'Those things that most people take for granted,\nI couldn't do a single one of them.'

'When all of my friends that I was so close to
realized, everyone kept their distance. I guess
that's obvious because we couldn't hang out
together.'
'That can't be true. If they were your\nfriends...'
If they were your friends, they wouldn't care,\nthey can still hang out with you.
Saying that might just be over-simplifying things\nthough.
At the very least, that is her actual experience\nof it.
'One time, in the homeroom, the teacher noticed\nthat I was isolated from the others, and said\nthis...'
'Kotori has been through so much. Let's all try\nto be get along with her.'
'...I was really shocked. I realized exactly the\npredicament I was in.'
'After that, I secretly cried by myself. I felt\nso frustrated, so pathetic...'
'To have everyone being so careful around me, I\nhated it but there was nothing I could do.'
Kotori's hands were trembling as she held onto\nthe hem of her skirt.
It looked like the frustration of that time had\ncome back to haunt her.
'That's why I came here. The school has full\nwheelchair access, so I could go there by myself\nwithout inconveniencing anyone.'
At our school, Kotori can go there by herself and\ncan get into and out of the classroom without\nanyone's help.
'...But it was no good. A place like school, you\ncan't just go there all by yourself.'
It's not just a physical problem.
It's a social environment, and you can't get by\nwithout being involved with other people.
'As well as that, is the danger that I might get\na puncture and won't be able to move, or that I\ncan't get into the bath by myself.'
'I'm just so tired of it all...'
She murmured as she spoke and looked across to\nWindmill Hill on the other bank.
The composed forms of the giant windmills seemed\nto have a calming effect on her.
'That would be... pretty tiring, wouldn't it?'
'It is, you know? Don't you think that I've tried\nreally hard until now?'
I agreed from the bottom of my heart.
I can't just say something simple like 'Try even\nharder!
'Is the search for new members for the Soaring\nClub going well?'
'It looks like we might be able to do something.\nI just hope we make it in time though.'
'I see. That's good.'
'That weird senior... She's been doing her best\nall by herself this whole time, hasn't she?'
'It would be terrible for her to have to stop\nhalfway, wouldn't it?'
'...I would like to try flying one day too. In\nthat glider.'
Kotori narrows her eyes as she speaks.
She looks across to the sky above Windmill Hill.
'Hey, you, ah... don't really wanna quit school,\ndo you?'
'That's not it. My mom and dad are worried about\nme too...'
'If I were to quit school and go back home, they\nwould be pleased.'
Kotori smiled when she said that, but to me, it\nlooked like she was forcing herself to smile.
I sat next to Kotori, and just like her, looked\nat the view of the opposite bank.
'Before I came back to Kazegaura, I was in the\nCycle Racing Club at a school really far from\nhere.'
When I started to speak, she glanced at me, and\ndidn't say anything while she listened to me.

'There are sports scholarships for bicycling too,
you know? I trained desperately daily: to win
races, and to be exempt from paying tuition
fees.'
'The practice was seriously tough but riding the\nbike felt good, so it didn't really feel like\nsuch hard work.'
'Bicycle road races are incredibly tiring.'
'In a big competition, you cycle 100 kilometers\nin one day.'
'100 kilometers... That's crazy.'
'It is, isn't it? Also, you have to go over hills\non the way.'
'Hill climbing is complete hell. While climbing,\nI always wanted to give up.'
'But, after climbing it, cycling down the hill\nfeels amazing.'
'Really...?'
I couldn't tell if Kotori was impressed or\nenvious when she responded.
'That part is fun, so that's why I thought I'd\ntry racing.'
'In one competition, I came third.'
'That's great. Was that a national\ncompetition...?'
I nod with pride.
Actually, that is one of the few things that I\ncan be proud of.
'An-chan came to watch. I was really happy about\nthat...'
'But then I got greedy...'
'In the first race of the second year, I had an\naccident.'
'While in the middle of the downhill section, I\nwas involved with another bike that had fallen\ndown, of all things...'
In that situation, I was competing with several\nother bikes.
I was in a hurry to get to the front, and got too\nclose to another bike.
Then, the accident occurred.
The other bike suddenly lost its balance and I\ngot tangled up with it, and hit the asphalt while\ntravelling at high speed.
With a bitter smile, I roll up the leg of my\npants on the right leg and show her.
'With that accident, my life as a racer, ended\nall too soon.'
The scar from the surgery is still fresh.
Kotori looked at it, and seemed to be at a loss\nfor words.
If it were her, she would be able to say that she\n'got away with just this scar'.
'With rehabilitation, I was able to walk again. I\nnow have no problems with everyday life, even the\ndoctors were amazed.'
'But I can't ride a bike anymore.'
'Is that the reason why you quit your previous\nschool?'
I nod quietly.
'I was a scholarship student, so it was hard for\nme to be there after I withdrew from school\nbut... I could've stayed there.'
'However, my friends from the Cycle Racing Club\nwere there, and I would watch them practicing...'
While I watched them doing their best from afar,\nI was unable to live a normal life.
My leg recovered after the rehabilitation, but\ninstead, I felt really depressed.
I thought that it would have been better if I\ncouldn't move at all because I could've just\ngiven up on it.
It was painful and difficult and I didn't know\nhow to handle all of my unfocused thoughts.
'That's why... I came back.'
'I ran away back to my hometown.'
Somehow, I felt a sense of relief, and I wrapped\nthe story.
Now that I think about it, this is the first time\nI've spoken to Kotori about this.
I haven't even confided in Ageha and the others\nabout this.
'...Sometimes we feel like running away, right?\nThere are more hardships in life than things that\nwe can enjoy.'
The things that Kotori says to comfort me are\nactually really pessimistic.
That must be how she really feels.
However, I didn't tell her this because I wanted\nto be comforted.
There are still things I want to say.
'...There are some things that I realized from\nrunning away.'
'There's nowhere else to go.'
'There's nowhere left to run to. It's like a dead\nend. But I cannot see the way forward either.'
'There is a way... For you, there are other\nways.'
'I thought I would regret it. Running away I\nmean.'
'But it wasn't like that.'
'My hometown is the same as it always was. It\nkindly welcomed me back.'
'...That's good, isn't it?'
'That makes it even worse.'
'The warmth of my hometown... It makes me forget\nmy pain and impatience.'
It feels like I'm gradually being paralyzed.
The pain...
The importance of the things I'd lost...
I'm forgetting them little by little.
If I lose that, will I still be me?
'You have something, the glider.'
'...Yeah.'
'I'm excited, to think I could fly in it.'
I envision myself flying through the air as I\nlook to the night sky.
After that, Kotori looks down.
'Do you have something like that?'
'...Something ahead of you if you quit school and\ngo back to your hometown.'
Kotori looked at me like she was in shock.
She desperately tried to hold back the tears that\nwere welling up and about to fall from her eyes.
'...Don't say things like that.'
'Something so cruel...'
Whether something lay ahead or not...
I realized then that she had a deep conflict\nwithin, even more than I thought she had.
'...You don't think there is anything ahead, do\nyou? That's why, if you have nothing left to do,\neverything is over?'
'No... That was just... for fun.'
'If you want a bath, I'll help you get in! If you\nget a puncture, I'll fix it for you!'
'I'll help you if you need it. So...'
A tear ran down Kotori's cheek.
But it was only a single tear.
'I don't want to be anymore of a burden than I\nalready am.'
'Give back my withdrawal notice.'
I went to get the withdrawal notice that I had\nstuck to the back of the drawer.
'...So that's where you hid it.'
When I held the withdrawal notice in my hand, the\nterrible things that I had said to her came to\nthe back of my mind.
...Do you have something like that?
...Something ahead of you if you quit school and\ngo back to your hometown.
I regret those words as I offer her the\nwithdrawal notice.
'...You dropped this, so I picked it up.'
'...Thanks.'
However, Kotori didn't take it straight away.
For her to take that, would be for her to decide\nher own future.
But in the end, she reached out her hand...
Shwup.
I quickly pulled it away, and she seemed\nembarrassed.
'I'm not gonna do it.'
'What?'
'I'm not gonna give it back.'
I held onto it and left the room.
'W-Welcome back! Dinner's ready!'
'It was very popular! We still have a whole pot\nleft. How about it?'
I walk up beside Kanako, as I make it look like\nI'm rummaging around the kitchen.
'What are you doing?'
Not long after, Kotori comes into the dining\nhall.
'Give my withdrawal notice back!'
'Withdrawal notice?'
'That's too bad. I've already hidden it somewhere\nelse.'
'What do you think you're doing!?'
'I won't accept it! Just give it another chance!'
'Huh? I don't know what you're talking about!'
Feelings that this situation wasn't fair were\nbubbling up inside me.
I know how Kotori feels.
It must have been incredibly difficult, and it\nmakes me feel a pain in my chest just imagining\nit.
But it's only been ten days since I came here.
I feel like I want to do something for her, but\nisn't the time that I've been given too short?
'I get it. I'm just being nosy, I totally get\nit.'
'Why are you talking to yourself? Give it back,\nit's mine!'
'No way. If you want it back, look for it\nyourself.'
'You're so mean!'
'What happened to the sad feelings you had and\nthe nice story that you were telling me just\nnow?'
'The hell if I know.'
'Grrrrr... You really are a meanie after all!'
I whistle badly and play dumb.
'Hey, Kanako!'
'Yes?'
'You saw where he hid it, didn't you?'
'Hmm, where was it now? Even if I knew, I\nwouldn't tell you.'
'Hey, if you weren't here, Kotori, I'd feel so\nsad!'
'GRRRRRRRR!!!!!!!!'
Kotori's face has gone red. Looks like her Rage\nGauge has reached MAX.
'Idiot! Moron! Knucklehead! I can still quit\nschool without it!'
Firing off a few parting shots, Kotori hurries\nout of the dining hall.
'Dinner's ready. You can heat it up in the\nmicrowave later!'
The door at the end of the hallway closed with a\nSLAM!
'...So, where did you hide it?'
I pull the piece of paper out from under my\nshirt.
'Not bad.'
'Thanks for your help.'
